p: Tannins and other phenolic compounds are also present in the seeds in quantities ranging from 0.03 to 7.5 mg/g of beans, lower than the amount of tannins in other beans [ 42]. They can inhibit enzymes non-specifically and precipitate with proteins and thus lower the amount of available protein in the food. Phytates are other anti-nutritional factors that are present in seeds in amounts between 6.1 and 7.5 mg/g of seeds, which is similar to the amount present in soy bean. However, these amounts are not very high, so it is not harmful [ 36]. Another component is present in the wax of mature leaves which is alkanes. Many n-alkanes are present in this wax ranging from n-C 16 to n-C 20 and from n-C 22 to n-C 35. Among these alkanes, n-C 29 and n-C 31 were the most abundant whereas n-C 20 and n-C 26 were the least abundant [ 43].
